messages.message: React Hook useEffect has missing dependencies: 'autoAdvanceInterval' and 'startAutoAdvance'. Either include them or remove the dependency array.

suggestions.desc: Update the dependencies array to be: [autoAdvanceInterval, startAutoAdvance]

messages.message: 'masterData' is assigned a value but never used.

source:

{/* Custom CSS for animations and font */} {/* Header Section */}

Ethereum: The World Computer

A decentralized, open-source blockchain with smart contract functionality.

{/* Key Highlights Section - Uses Grid for layout */}
{/* Highlight Card 1 */}

Key Highlights

  • **Market Cap Rank:** #2 (as of early 2024, fluctuates)
  • **Transactions per Second:** ~15-30 TPS (on Layer 1, scales with Layer 2s)
  • **Consensus Mechanism:** Proof-of-Stake (since The Merge)
{/* Highlight Card 2 */}

What Can Ethereum Do?

  • **Decentralized Finance (DeFi):** Lending, borrowing, DEXs.
  • **Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs):** Digital art, collectibles, gaming assets.
  • **Gaming:** Play-to-earn games, metaverse experiences.
  • **Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs):** Community governance.
  • **Supply Chain Management:** Tracking goods and transparency.
{/* Highlight Card 3 */}

Understanding Gas Fees

Gas on Ethereum measures computational effort and is paid in Ether (ETH).

  • **Purpose:** Incentivizes validators, prevents network spam.
  • **Calculation:** Varies by transaction complexity.
  • **Unit:** Gwei (1 Gwei = 0.000000001 ETH).
{/* Accordion Sections - Centralized for readability */}

Ethereum was conceptualized by Vitalik Buterin in 2013 and officially launched in 2015. It aimed to create a more generalized blockchain platform beyond just cryptocurrency.

  • **2013:** Whitepaper published by Vitalik Buterin.
  • **2014:** Crowdsale raises funds for development.
  • **July 30, 2015:** Frontier, the first live release of Ethereum, goes live.
  • **2016:** The DAO hack and subsequent hard fork (Ethereum Classic divergence).
  • **2017:** ICO boom drives significant network activity.
  • **December 2020:** Beacon Chain launches, marking the start of Ethereum&aposs transition to Proof-of-Stake.
  • **September 15, 2022:** The Merge (Proof-of-Work to Proof-of-Stake transition).
  • **April 12, 2023:** Shanghai/Capella (Shapella) upgrade enables ETH withdrawals from staking.

Ethereum's core innovation is its ability to execute smart contracts, self-executing agreements written in code.

  • **Language:** Primarily Solidity, but also Vyper and Yul.
  • **Virtual Machine:** Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) executes smart contract bytecode.
  • **Developer Friendly:** Robust developer tools, extensive documentation, and a large community.

Ethereum's ecosystem benefits from widely adopted token and interoperability standards.

  • **Token Standards:** ERC-20 (fungible), ERC-721 (NFTs), ERC-1155 (multi-token).
  • **Layer 2 Solutions:** Rollups (Optimistic and ZK-Rollups) for scalability.
  • **Interoperability:** Bridges to other chains.

Ethereum is a **public, permissionless blockchain**, meaning anyone can participate and build on it without needing permission.

  • **Financial Services:** Decentralized exchanges, lending platforms, insurance.
  • **Gaming & Entertainment:** Play-to-earn models, digital ownership, metaverse.
  • **Art & Collectibles:** NFTs for digital and physical asset representation.
  • **Identity & Governance:** Self-sovereign identity, DAOs for community governance.

Ethereum consistently ranks as a top blockchain ecosystem due to its pioneering role, robust developer community, and the sheer volume of dApps built on it.

  • **Market Capitalization:** Consistently ranks among the top cryptocurrencies by market cap.
  • **Total Value Locked (TVL):** Holds a significant portion of the total value locked in DeFi.
  • **Developer Activity:** One of the most active developer communities in the blockchain space.

)} {/* Resources & Community Links Section - Uses Grid for layout */}

Resources & Community

{/* Link Card 1 */}

Official Resources

  • Official Website
  • Developer Docs
  • Whitepaper
{/* Link Card 2 */}

Connect with Ethereum

  • Twitter/X
  • Reddit
  • YouTube
{/* Link Card 3 */}

Code & Development

  • GitHub Org
  • Go Ethereum (Geth)
{/* Link Card 4 */}

Community & Support

  • Community Forum
  • StackExchange
  • Ethereum Foundation
{/* Link Card 5 */}

Block Explorers & Analytics

  • Etherscan
  • Ethplorer
  • Dune Analytics
{/* Link Card 6 */}

Key Differentiators

  • Pioneering Smart Contracts
  • Largest Ecosystem
  • Robust Security & Decentralization
  • Active Layer 2 Scaling
{/* Roadmap Section - As a final accordion */}

Ethereum continues to evolve with a focus on scalability, security, and sustainability. Key areas of ongoing development include:

  • **Sharding:** Dividing the network into smaller shards to process transactions in parallel, significantly increasing throughput.
  • **Verkle Trees:** Optimizing state growth and enabling stateless clients.
  • **Proto-Danksharding (EIP-4844):** A precursor to full sharding, introducing blobs to reduce transaction costs for rollups.
